chapter_description.p: The Types module provides tools for managing and inspecting data types in Nelson.
It allows users to query the nature of variables, distinguish between numeric, logical, string, and object types, and work with specialized types such as sparse or integer arrays.
The module also supports creation of objects and validation of variable names, helping ensure type safety and consistency across scripts and functions.

keyword.name: class
keyword.description: Return classname of object or creates a named object.

keyword.name: isa
keyword.description: Return true if var is an object from the class str.

keyword.name: iscell
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a cell array.

keyword.name: ischar
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a char array.

keyword.name: isclass
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a class object.

keyword.name: isdouble
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a double matrix.

keyword.name: isempty
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is an empty matrix.

keyword.name: isfloat
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a single or double matrix.

keyword.name: ishandle
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a handle object.

keyword.name: isint16
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a signed 16-bit integer type array.

keyword.name: isint32
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a signed 32-bit integer type array.

keyword.name: isint64
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a signed 64-bit integer type array.

keyword.name: isint8
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a signed 8-bit integer type array.

keyword.name: isinteger
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a integer type array.

keyword.name: islogical
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a logical.

keyword.name: isnumeric
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a numeric array.

keyword.name: isobject
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is an object.

keyword.name: isreal
keyword.description: Return true if all imaginary part is a zero array.

keyword.name: issingle
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a single matrix.

keyword.name: issparse
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a sparse array.

keyword.name: isstring
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a string array.

keyword.name: isstruct
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is a structure.

keyword.name: isuint16
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is an unsigned 16-bit integer type array.

keyword.name: isuint32
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is an unsigned 32-bit integer type array.

keyword.name: isuint64
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is an unsigned 64-bit integer type array.

keyword.name: isuint8
keyword.description: Return true if variable var is an unsigned 8-bit integer type array.

keyword.name: isvarname
keyword.description: Return true if input is valid variable name.

keyword.name: missing
keyword.description: Return a missing value.
